page.title: 11UNEMPLOYMENT-CRAFT REVIVAL
page.content: When the work force at the giant Rank Xerox plant at Mitcheldean was drastically cut, some three years ago, the unemployment caused was severe, although relatively few in our area were affected. Finding new jobs in a rural area is very difficult, and many have turned to old crafts as an occupation. One very thriving small business was started in this way when a{Gunsmith's workshop was opened in{Barrell Lane. There is now a work-force of three and the business has expanded to include not only repair work but also the making of shotguns and rifles, and the provision of shooting tuition, thus catering for members of the shooting syndicates and the Clay Pigeon clubs.
